author: tjayrush
content:
I've just read about 200 messages, catching up. One thing I'm not seeing is any comments about the sort of "Public Relations" aspect of the merge. I think it might be wise to try to tamp down the expectations. So make sure that people in the larger community know that there is a real possibility that there may be a delay. This, as opposed to, two months before the supposed Merge telling people there will be a delay.

Also, I think it wouldn't hurt if the Ethereum Foundation and/or the Core Devs started approaching project teams (DeFi, NFT platforms, Exchanges, etc.) whose business depend very heavily on the success of the merge and shame them into providing a massive testing effort. Those 'users' of the chain don't have to be core devs, but they should definitely take responsibility for testing. This would also make the decision to delay or not something that's not only on the shoulders of the Core Devs. If you're the member of a non-core dev team that depends on a successful merge, speak up--offer help testing.

Finally, I think the Ethereum Foundation should take on the responsibility of handling this Public Relations function, as this, I think is their function.
